evidence_span: Raw material of Zircaloy-4 with a composition listed in Table 1 was heated at 1030 to 1050°C for β-quench to form solid solution, annealed at 680°C for 2 h for the recrystallization and further annealed at 475°C for 3 h in vacuum.
process_step: β-quench at 1030-1050°C; annealed at 680°C for 2h; annealed at 475°C for 3h in vacuum

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_032_chunk5
evidence_span: Raw material of Zircaloy-2 having the composition presented in Table 1 was heated at 1030 to 1050°C for β-quench, annealed at 700°C

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_032_chunk5
evidence_span: the β phase of Zircaloy-4 after heat treatments over 830°C quenching and 1030°C annealing is in a superparamagnetic state which contains particles of Zr(Fe₁₋ₓCrₓ) so small (10 to 20 Å)
process_step: heat treatments over 830°C quenching and 1030°C annealing

source_id: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_032_chunk5
evidence_span: After heat treatments above 900°C, magnetization for Zircaloy-4 increases more than three times
